Microsoft Teams channel files are located to SharePoint Online and Microsoft Teams chat files are stored to OneDrive.

Each team in Microsoft Teams has a corresponding SharePoint site, and each channel within a team has its own folder within that site’s "Documents" library. When files are shared in a channel, they’re stored in the relevant folder within the SharePoint site connected to that team.

OneDrive for Business and SharePoint Online (Files):

First-stage Recycle Bin: Deleted files go here first and stay for 93 days by default.
Second-stage Recycle Bin: After being removed from the first-stage Recycle Bin, files are moved here and remain until the end of the 93-day retention period. Once this period expires, files are permanently deleted and unrecoverable.

Client-side labelling when users edit documents or compose (also reply or forward) emails: Use a label that's configured for auto-labelling for files and emails (includes Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook).

Service-side labelling when content is already saved (in SharePoint or OneDrive) or emailed (processed by Exchange Online): Use an auto-labelling policy. You might also hear this method referred to as auto-labelling for data at rest. For Exchange, it doesn't include emails at rest (mailboxes).
